title: Book Bolt Review - Is It Really Worth It?

tactics.name: Keyword Research Tool
tactics.description: Use Book Bolt's Keywords tool to identify underserved niches with low competition.
steps: Search for book categories like 'logbook' or 'puzzle book'
Adjust Amazon Most Trending results to 100 entries
Explore deeper pages (4th-5th) for less saturated terms
caveats: Free trial limits may expire before full research
source_quotes: This is the tool that I use the most on Book Bolt.
I recommend going to something like the fourth or fifth page.

tactics.name: Keyword Hearting
tactics.description: Save high-search-volume keywords for later analysis by clicking the heart icon.
steps: Scroll through keywords and heart those with >1,000 monthly searches
Group similar keywords (e.g., rv logbook variations)
Check competition scores via Favorites list
caveats: Avoid over-competitive niches like RV logbooks
source_quotes: 'make sure it has over 1,000 people searching for it each month'

tactics.name: A-Rated Niche Prioritization
tactics.description: Focus on A-rated niches with low competition and high buyer demand.
steps: Filter Favorites list to show only A-rated niches
Test A-rated niches with low estimated sales volume
Create multiple books targeting related keywords
caveats: Avoid D/E/F rated niches unless personally motivated
source_quotes: 'I stick to the A-rated niches because they are low-hanging fruit'

tactics.name: Find Underserved Niches
tactics.description: Use Book Bolt's Cloud feature to analyze 30-day sales data and competition scores, prioritizing niches with low competition and higher sales averages.
steps: Use Cloud feature to pull Amazon data for niche keywords
Filter by competition score and ignore estimated monthly sales
caveats: Avoid relying on estimated monthly sales metrics
source_quotes: Although this is another great tool... click on Notebook, switch it to the type of book...

tactics.name: Customize Templates for Niches
tactics.description: Use pre-made templates and modify content to fit specific niches like sailing logbooks.
steps: Find existing books in the target niche on Amazon KDP
Edit content variables while keeping layout consistent
Duplicate customized pages across the book
Design covers within KDP's safe zones (green lines)
caveats: Requires niche research when lacking domain knowledge
source_quotes: If you don't know what goes into a sailing logbook, look up existing ones on Amazon KDP

heuristics.name: Deep Page Niche Selection
heuristics.condition: If niche appears on 4th+ page of search results, then it's less competitive
source_quotes: I recommend going to something like the fourth or fifth page.

heuristics.name: A-Rated Niche Boost
heuristics.condition: If a niche has an A-rated competition score, prioritize it
source_quotes: 'an A would be really good. That's where we want to be aiming for'

heuristics.name: Prioritize 30-Day Sales
heuristics.condition: If niche has 169+ 30-day sales average, prioritize over low estimated monthly sales
source_quotes: Estimated moving average sales... is an estimated 169 sales

heuristics.name: Template Reuse Strategy
heuristics.condition: If creating a new book in a similar niche, reuse existing templates
source_quotes: Create a couple different covers and use them as templates for new books

claims.statement: Book Bolt offers a 3-day free trial with unlimited downloads
source_quotes: the three-day free trial has full access with unlimited downloads

claims.statement: Estimated monthly sales volume in Book Bolt is often lower than actual sales
source_quotes: 'estimated monthly sales volume is two. Just know that the estimated monthly sales volume is not always accurate'

claims.statement: Book Bolt's Cloud feature provides accurate 30-day sales data for niche analysis
source_quotes: This is going to pull data directly from Amazon... averages over the last 30 days

claims.statement: KDP rejects books with sizing errors due to strict print specifications
source_quotes: They reject your book because it is off by a fraction of an inch

niche_patterns.example: puzzle book + low review count + trending search
niche_patterns.description: Target underserved niches with high search volume and low competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances demand with ease of content creation
source_quotes: this is a gold mine of information for Amazon KDP sellers
you can create a lot of books while still on the three-day free trial

niche_patterns.description: Target specific identities with clear product needs in underserved markets
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity targeting with problem-solving constraints for low-competition niches
source_quotes: 'sailboat logbook, that would be the first one I would be copying'
